data.title: LINDON DAYS
data.text:
Kick off Lindon Days with Lindon’s Pickleball Mixer Tournament! Get ready for a thrilling day of competition and camaraderie at our Mixed Doubles Pickleball Tournament.

Sign up as a single player, and you will play with different players throughout the event. We will play 6 round-robin games followed by a single elimination tournament. Hurry! Spots are limited and will fill up fast.

​

Saturday, August 3rd

Mixer Intermediate (3.0-3.5) - 8:00-12:00 PM

Mixer Advanced (4.0+) - 5:00-9:00 PM

​​​​

DATE: Saturday, Aug 3

TIME: Various Times

LOCATION: Anderson Farms Park (1550 W Lancaster Way)

CONTACT: Sheen Beard, sbeard@lindon.gov

Come saddle up and join us for a beautiful mountain morning trail ride! We will start the ride at 9am at the South Fork Transfer Station up Provo Canyon. Please have your horses trailered there, tacked up, and ready to ride by 9am sharp. After the trail ride a lunch will be provided. We will also have a raffle with some great prizes! Participation if free. Please contact Shawnee Rasmussen (353)-535-7719 or Floyd Harward (801)-361-8762 with questions or to RSVP.

​

​

​

DATE: Saturday August 3rd

TIME: 9:00 AM

LOCATION: South Fork Equestrian Staging, Provo Canyon

CONTACT: Shawnee Rasmussen (385)-535-7719, or Floyd Harward (801)-361-8762

​

Lindon’s 5K and Fun Run will start and end at the City Center Park this year for a chance to get an early glimpse of the Lindon Fair! Join us for this family friendly event to kickoff Lindon Days!

Please register by July 27th to receive a swag bag!

Packet pickup August 2nd from 4:00pm - 6:00pm and the morning of the race, August 3rd, starting at 6:30am at the Lindon City Center Park.

​

​

​

​

​

DATE: Saturday August 3rd

TIME: 5K (7:00 AM), Kids 1 Mile (8:00 AM)

LOCATION: City Center Park (200 N State)

CONTACT: McKindra Camp, mcamp@lindon.gov

Harley Dunn, hdunn@lindon.gov

Coming back for this years Centennial Celebration is Lindon’s Stringtown Fair. To commemorate how this all started, we will have games, Creators Collective Market booths, food vendors, local performers, contests, and more!

Buy your wristband for the fair games at the Community Center at the event. Each wristband is $5 and has seven tickets on it. Each game is one ticket.

You do not want to miss out on all the nostalgia of old time Lindon. Bring your family for a fun filled day at the park.

​

Event Lineup

11:00 AM - Pie Eating Contest

12:00 PM - Bluegrass Thunder Band

1:00 PM - Nail Hammer Competition

2:00 PM - Corner Dance Performance

3:00 PM - Musical Chairs

4:00 PM - Story Teller

5:00 PM - Seed Spitting

5:30 PM - Island Dance Studio

6:30 PM - Age Races

7:00 PM - Shane Lee Band

​

Food Trucks

Brazilian Paradise

Burger Pioneers

Dippy's Corndogs

Jurassic Tacos

Nachos Live

and more!

​​​​​​​​​

DATE: Saturday August 3rd

TIME: 11:00-8:00 PM

LOCATION: City Park (200 N State Street)

CONTACT: Delilah Collings, contact@creatorscollectivemarket.com

Want to host a booth at the Fair? Be a part of this Centennial Event and sign up for a booth today brought to you by the Creators Collective Market! Click the link below to get more info and to sign up.

Meet Funeral Potatoes: For the past 22 years, Funeral Potatoes have been captivating Utah County communities with uplifting music, with lush harmonies and thought-provoking stories. Come listen to The Funeral Potatoes and learn more about the long history of their group, and why they consider themselves “comfort music."

Bring your chairs, blankets and snacks and enjoy the evening with us.

​

DATE: Sunday, August 4th

TIME: 7:30 PM

LOCATION: Lindon City Center Park (200 N State)

CONTACT: Jamie Jensen, jjensen@lindon.gov

Our Centennial Car Show is here! This timeless event is great for the entire family! With countless cars, trucks, motorcycles, tricycles, and more, it is an event you don’t want to miss out on! Come hungry and try some of the food trucks!

​

Interested in showing off your vehicle this year? Registration is FREE so click the button below to register or call into the Community Center at 801-769-8625. You can also sign up at the registration booth the before the event.

​

​

​

DATE: Monday, August 5th

TIME: 4:00-9:00 PM

LOCATION: Pheasant Brook Park (400 N 800 W)

CONTACT: Heath Bateman, hbateman@lindon.gov

​

While you are at the Car Show, come get dinner at one of our many food vendors! Grab dinner, check out the cars, and see the chalk art on the sidewalk around the park. Vendor list coming soon.

​

DATE: Monday, August 5th

TIME: 4:00-9:00 PM

LOCATION: Pheasant Brook Park (400 N 800 W)

CONTACT: Harley Dunn, hdunn@lindon.gov

​

Ever wondered what is inside the old home at Pioneer Park? Come find out and take a tour of the historic Harris Pioneer home! Learn some fun facts about the home and preserved items inside. This is a great opportunity to expand your knowledge of Lindon! Tours of the historic home are available starting at 7:00 PM or through-out the year by contacting the Lindon City Community Development department at (801) 785-7687.

​

DATE: Tuesday, August 6th

TIME: 7:00 PM

LOCATION: Pioneer Park (150 S 500 E)

CONTACT: Alan Walker, awalker@lindon.gov

​

Join the Lindon Police Department for the 2024 National Night Out Against Crime! This national event is an annual community-building campaign that promotes police-community partnerships and neighborhood camaraderie to make our neighborhoods a safer, better place to live. Come learn and participate in fun activities that will help educate the whole family about safety.

​

DATE: Tuesday, August 6th

TIME: 7:00 PM

LOCATION: Pioneer Park (150 S 500 E)

CONTACT: Alan Walker, awalker@lindon.gov

​

Before the movie in the park, head over to the pavilion and snag a free ice cream treat served by our wonderful City Council! This is a great time to get to know your local elected officials and mingle over some delicious free ice cream!

​

DATE: Tuesday, August 6

TIME: 8:00 PM

LOCATION: Pioneer Park (150 S 500 E)

CONTACT: Alan Walker, awalker@lindon.gov

Join Bank of Utah and Lindon Parks & Rec for another amazing Lindon Days Movie in the Park! Enjoy Kung Fu Panda 4 with your family at Pioneer Park! The show will begin at dusk. Come with your chairs and blankets and have a great time with your family, friends, and our great Lindon community! BIG SHOUT-OUT to the Lindon Bank of Utah who has been the proud sponsor of Movies in the Park for many years! Make sure to visit the Lindon Bank of Utah and thank them for helping put on the Movies in the Park!

​

DATE: Tuesday, August 6th

TIME: Dusk

LOCATION: Pioneer Park (150 S 500 E)

CONTACT: Alan Walker, awalker@lindon.gov

Back by popular demand is our chess tournament. This is a fast moving tournament and you do not need to be a pro to play! Age groups will be 12 and under, 13-17, and 18 years and older.

​

​​​​​​​​

DATE: Wednesday, August 7th

TIME: 10:00 AM

LOCATION: Lindon Community Center (25 N Main St)

CONTACT: Alan Walker, awalker@lindon.gov

Come to Fryer Park for some good old-fashioned fun! We will have the fish ready and the park full of water ready for fishing! Come ready to get wet with your fishing nets and buckets and try to take home a WHOPPER!

​

Event subject to change depending on fish availability and drought conditions.

​

DATE: Wednesday, August 7th

TIME: 6:30 PM

LOCATION: Fryer Park (600 N Main Street)

CONTACT: Alan Walker, awalker@lindon.gov

Join the Utah Valley Astronomy Club for an evening under the stars! Bring your own telescope and receive tips and instructions from Lindon’s best stargazers or use the telescopes provided to view star clusters, nebulae, and galaxies under expert guidance from some amazing telescopes! Small treats will be provided for the best views of our stars.

​

DATE: Wednesday, August 7th

TIME: 9:30 PM

LOCATION: Dry Canyon Trailhead Parking Lot

CONTACT: Alan Walker, awalker@lindon.gov

Grab your boots and hat and head down to the rodeo arena to experience Lindons’ "little bit of country".

Pre-rodeo entertainment includes the stick horse race and cash cow starting at 6pm. All pre-rodeo events are free and require no registration.

​

If you have a stick horse at home, we encourage you to bring it with you! We want to round up as many as we can so that every child gets a chance to ride!

​

PRE-RODEO EVENTS

Cash cow: ages 10 & under, and 11 to 17

Stick horse race: ages 3-7, 8-16, 17+

​

​

DATE: Thursday, August 8th

TIME: 6:00 PM

LOCATION: Lindon Horse Arena (200 N Main)

CONTACT: Shane or Shawnee Rasmussen (385)-535-7719, or Floyd Harward (801)-361-8762

​

The rodeo will start at 7pm sharp and include mutton bustin, steer riding, and barrel racing. Be sure to stay for the whole show for your chance to win some great raffle prizes! After the rodeo, everyone of all ages can join us in the arena for the dirt dance!

(Registration for all events is limited and online pre-registration is required! There will be no same day entries for any event that requires registration. Participants must bring their own helmets for mutton bustin and horse for the horse events.)

​

$10 Events that require online pre-registration:

Mutton bustin: Helmets are required and each participant MUST bring their own or they will not be allowed to ride.

Ages 3+ and under 60 pounds.

Pole Bending: Any age.

Barrel Racing: Any age.

Steer Riding: 12-16

Register for events at LindonRecreation.org/lindon-days.

Are you a Mario Kart Master?? Put your skills to the test! Sign up for our double-elimination style tournament this Lindon Days! All equipment will be provided and awesome prizes are up for grabs. Age groups are 8-12, 13-16, and 17+. All equipment is provided, personal equipment not allowed. Grand prizes for the winners of each group! No walk-in registration, sign up today at the link below!

​

​

​​​​

DATE: Friday, August 9th

TIME: 10:00 AM

LOCATION: Community Center (25 N Main)

CONTACT: Harley Dunn, hdunn@lindon.gov

​

Grab a seat along our new Parade route with your family, friends and neighbors and watch our Lindon Days Grand Parade. Cheer and wave to the bands, dancers, local business and elected officials. There will be floats, horses, music, and all the things! Collect flyers, coupons, merchandise and candy galore! Join us at Fryer Park after the parade for a special Hot Dog Surprise!

​

If you are interested in providing an entry into the Lindon Parade, follow the link below. Entry is free!

​​​

DATE: Friday, August 9th

TIME: 7:00 PM

LOCATION: Lindon 400 N (beginning at Canal Drive) traveling West to 200 E, traveling North to 600 N. Ends at Fryer Park with a special Hot Dog Surprise!

CONTACT: Jamie Jensen, jjensen@lindon.gov

​

Come dive for some dimes! At this event, Bank of Utah and our Little Miss Lindon royalty will be tossing $800 worth of dimes between three of our four age groups. Test your diving ability and snag some free money for spending or saving.

​

Age Groups: 0-3 (floating toys), 4-6 (dimes and toys), 7-10, & 11-14

DATE: Saturday, August 10th

TIME: 1:30 PM

LOCATION: Lindon Aquatics Center (60 W 60 N)

CONTACT: Harley Dunn, hdunn@lindon.gov

Join us for our Annual Belly Flop Competition! Competitors will flop into the deep end of the lap pool from starter blocks. Our panel of judges will score the flop based on creativity, belly painting, water splash radius, splash sound, redness, etc. Prizes will be distributed for Best Splash, Most Creative Belly, and of course, Red Belly. Sign up at the tent inside the pool. This competition is for belly floppers of all ages.

​

DATE: Saturday, August 10th

TIME: 2:30PM

LOCATION: Lindon Aquatics Center (60 W 60 N)

CONTACT: Harley Dunn, hdunn@lindon.gov

Sign up for our Annual KenDucky Derby when you arrive at the pool for Free Swim Day. We provide the numbered ducks, you provide your name. Participation is free and for all ages. The fastest duck down the slide, through the lazy river and to the finish line will be our Grand Prize winner. The 24 ducks following our champion duck will receive grab bags. Participants must be in attendance to win. Come cheer on the ducks and hope that lady luck is on your side.

​

DATE: Saturday, August 10th

TIME: 3:30 PM

LOCATION: Lindon Aquatics Center (60 W 60 N)

CONTACT: Alan Walker, awalker@lindon.gov

After a day of swimming, satisfy your hunger at Pheasant Brook Park. We'll have a handful of food vendors set up and ready before our evening pre-show and concert. There will be a variety to vendors choose from.​

​

Interested in bringing YOUR truck? Contact Harley!

​

DATE: Saturday, August 10th

TIME: 6:30 PM

LOCATION: Pheasant Brook Park (400 N 800 W)

CONTACT: Harley Dunn, hdunn@lindon.gov

To help celebrate our Centennial year, we will be droping 10k ping-pong’s from the famous Fugal black helicopter! Get ready for the park to be covered in ping-pong balls!! The ages will be from 2 (with parents help) to 16 years old. Find the winning balls for a prize!

​

Don’t forget to pre-game with us by playing fun lawn games before the show. Lots of fun things happening before the concert starts so make sure you are ready!

​

DATE: Saturday, August 10th

TIME: 7:00 PM

LOCATION: Pheasant Brook Park (400 N 800 W)

CONTACT: Heath Bateman, hbateman@lindon.gov

Can you say fun?! YES! Look no further than Exit Strategy!! These guys have rocked audiences from Vegas to Orlando, Vienna to Barcelona, and Cannes to Malta -- don’t forget LINDON! They know how to move a crowd! They will get the crowd up and on their feet! With a collection of high energy funk, blues, and pop classics, these guys will have you singing, dancing, and laughing all night long!

​

Following EXIT STRATEGY, we will have a firework show! Fireworks to follow at approx. 10PM

​

​

DATE: Saturday, August 10th

TIME: 8:30PM

LOCATION: Pheasant Brook Park (400 N 800 W)

CONTACT: Heath Bateman, hbateman@lindon.gov
